DataElement.preferredDefinition: The condition, disease, symptom or disorder that the concomitant (non-study) medication/treatment/therapy was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the medication/treatment/therapy was taken or administered).

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: For what indication, was the
ReferenceDocuments.description: For what indication, was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This is not the pharmacological/therapeutic classification of an agent (e.g., antibiotic, analgesic, etc.), but the reason for its administration to the subject. This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor would want to capture the reason(s) why a subject took a medication/treatment. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (i.e., in the classification of medications), for reconciling the medications/treatments taken by a subject with their provided medical history and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process, etc.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CMINDC
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the reason the medication was taken based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If taken to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If taken to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).
